title: Miscompilation on i686-pc-windows-msvc with Fat LTO

labels.name: A-LLVM
labels.description: Area: Code generation parts specific to LLVM. Both correctness bugs and optimization-related issues.

labels.name: I-unsound
labels.description: Issue: A soundness hole (worst kind of bug), see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soundness

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

labels.name: I-prioritize
labels.description: Indicates that prioritization has been requested for this issue

body:
I tried this code:

https://github.com/swc-project/swc/blob/275db1baec0046c15e35456c268295c5e7a42517/crates/swc_ecma_codegen/src/lib.rs#L2435-L2463

(May not be exact, just a guess based on the test failure)


I expected to see this happen: Binaries behave identically regardless of CPU arch.

Instead, this happened: CI for publishing action failed.

### Meta

I'm trying to enable LTO for release builds of [swc](https://swc.rs), with https://github.com/swc-project/swc/pull/7509. But it seems like `rustc` miscompiles on some platforms if I enable LTO.

Full log: https://github.com/swc-project/swc/actions/runs/5212808850/jobs/9406918334?pr=7509

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.70.0-nightly (da7c50c08 2023-03-19)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: da7c50c089d5db2d3ebaf227fe075bb1346bfaec
commit-date: 2023-03-19
host: aarch64-apple-darwin
release: 1.70.0-nightly
LLVM version: 15.0.7
```
